intro: Haplocarpha scaposa, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a composite head. Haplocarpha scaposa is generally short-lived and has a low-growing form, making it a minor component of its native ecosystems.
